com.intel.icecp.core.attributes

Interface Attributes


  • public interface Attributes
    Container class to manage the attributes for a Describable thing--think of this container as a set of attributes. In the future, this container could (should?) be generated using Java annotations (tutorial for annotation processing at http://hannesdorfmann.com/annotation-processing/annotationprocessing101/).

    An attribute describes the current value of a property; for example, a node can have a "state" attribute that will indicate whether the node is currently "running," "stopped," etc. Some attributes are also writeable (see WriteableAttribute) which allows user code, even remote code, to change the value of an attribute.

    Access to attributes falls under two categories: 1) access from code that has knowledge of the types of the attributes and 2) access from code that does not. For the first case, this API exposes methods that allow passing the class type (e.g. Class) as the identifier for interacting with the attribute--this ensures that while changing the attribute implementations developers will see compiler errors if the generic types are not aligned correctly.

    The second case requires methods that identify an attribute using a pair--the attribute name and the attribute's value type. This allows remote access to an attribute without having the implementing class (e.g. MyAttribute.class) available. The attribute's value type (e.g. Integer) is required and should be exposed using an external schema language (TODO consider JSON-LD support). Additional type checking and casting is performed in these methods so local code should prefer the first method, described above.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(Attribute attribute)
  throws AttributeRegistrationException
        Add a new attribute to the set of describable attributes. If the attribute already exists in the attribute set, this method will replace it.

        This method must be protected using the AttributePermission's add action.

        TODO this method could return the instance itself for easier builder patterns

        Parameters:
        attribute - a new attribute implementation
        Throws:
        AttributeRegistrationException

      • remove

        <T> T remove(Class<? extends Attribute<T>> attributeType)
      throws AttributeNotFoundException
        Remove an attribute from the set of describable attributes. Prefer this method if you have access to the attribute implementation class.

        This method must be protected using the AttributePermission's remove action.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of values returned by the attribute
        Parameters:
        attributeType - the class of the attribute implementation
        Returns:
        the last known value of the attribute
        Throws:
        AttributeNotFoundException - if the attribute has not been added

      • remove

        <T> T remove(String attributeName,
             Class<T> attributeValueType)
      throws AttributeNotFoundException
        Remove an attribute from the set of describable attributes. Prefer this method if you are accessing an attribute of unknown implementation; use of has(Class) prior to this call is helpful

        This method must be protected using the AttributePermission's remove action.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of values returned by the attribute
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the unique name of the attribute
        attributeValueType - the type of values returned by the attribute
        Returns:
        the last known value of the attribute
        Throws:
        AttributeNotFoundException - if the attribute has not been added

      • has

        boolean has(Class<? extends Attribute> attributeType)
        Determine if the attribute set contains the given attribute
        Parameters:
        attributeType - the class of the attribute implementation
        Returns:
        true if the attribute exists in the set, false otherwise

      • has

        boolean has(String attributeName)
        Determine if the attribute set contains the given attribute
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the unique name of the attribute
        Returns:
        true if the attribute exists in the set, false otherwise

      • set

        <T> void set(Class<? extends Attribute<T>> attributeType,
             T newValue)
      throws AttributeNotFoundException,
             AttributeNotWriteableException
        Assign a new value to an attribute. Prefer this method if you have access to the attribute implementation class.

        This method must be protected using the AttributePermission's write action.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of values accepted by the attribute
        Parameters:
        attributeType - the class of the attribute implementation
        newValue - the value to set the attribute to
        Throws:
        AttributeNotFoundException - if the attribute has not been added
        AttributeNotWriteableException - if the added attribute is not writeable

        void observe(String attributeName,
             OnAttributeChanged onAttributeChanged)
        Observe an attribute's changes after they occur; implementations should be able to handle multiple callbacks for the same attribute name. TODO add a class-indexed version of this
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the attribute name
